word: Elder Andrews is a conscientious servant of Jesus Christ. . . . We sent you the ablest man in all our ranks. . . . We needed Elder Andrews here. But we thought his great caution, his experience, his God-fearing dignity in the desk, would be just what you needed. We hoped you would accept his counsel, and aid him in every way possible while he was a stranger in a strange country.--Letter 2a, 1878. (To "Dear Brethren in Switzerland," August 29, 1878.)
